gov.nasa.jpf.vm

Class GenericHeap

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nasa.jpf.vm.GenericHeap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Heap, Iterable<ElementInfo>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GenericSGOIDHeap

    public abstract class GenericHeap
extends Object
implements Heap, Iterable<ElementInfo>
    this is an abstract root for Heap implementations, providing a standard mark&sweep collector, change attribute management, and generic pinDownList, weakReference and internString handling The concrete Heap implementors have to provide the ElementInfo collection and associated getters, allocators and iterators

      • getNewElementInfoIndex

        protected abstract int getNewElementInfoIndex(AllocationContext ctx)
        this is called for newXX(..) allocations that are SUT thread specific, i.e. in response to a explicit NEW or xNEWARRAY instruction that should take the allocating thread into account

      • queueMark

        public void queueMark(int objref)
        add a non-null, not yet marked reference to the markQueue called from ElementInfo.markRecursive(). We don't want to expose the markQueue since a copying collector might not have it
        Specified by:

      • cleanUpDanglingReferences

        public void cleanUpDanglingReferences()
        clean up reference values that are stored outside of reference fields called from KernelState to process live ElementInfos after GC has finished and only live objects remain in the heap. <2do> full heap enumeration is BAD - check if this can be moved into the sweep loop
        Specified by:
        cleanUpDanglingReferences in interface Heap

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive(ElementInfo ei)
        check if object is alive. This is here and not in ElementInfo because we might own the liveness bit. In fact, the generic implementation uses bit-toggle to avoid iteration over all live objects at the end of GC
        Specified by:
        isAlive in interface Heap
